news.title: Astronomers gear up to discover Earth-like planets
news.summary: As part of an international team of exoplanets hunters, astronomers at the University of Arizona are developing a technique to detect faint dust clouds around other stars, many of which might hide Earth-like planets.

news.title: Astronomers gear up to discover Earth-like planets
news.summary: If one looks only for the shiniest pennies in the fountain, chances are one misses most of the coins because they shimmer less brightly. This, in a nutshell, is the conundrum astronomers face when searching for Earth-like planets outside our solar system.

news.title: Astronomers gear up to discover Earth-like planets
news.summary: ( University of Arizona ) Dust clouds around stars are thought to hide many undiscovered planets with conditions suitable for life, but observations have been hampered by the fact that only the brightest such clouds can be detected with current technology.

wikipedia.title: Exozodiacal dust
wikipedia.summary: Exozodiacal dust is the exoplanetary analog of zodiacal dust, the 1–100 micrometre-sized grains of amorphous carbon and silicate dust that fill the plane of the solar system, especially interior to the asteroid belt.

wikipedia.title: Planetary system
wikipedia.summary: A planetary system is a set of gravitationally bound non-stellar objects in orbit around a star or star system.
